events.name: IMF Reaches Staff-Level Agreement with Ukraine for $15.6 Billion Loan
events.wd_label: IMF Reaches Staff-Level Agreement with Ukraine for $15.6 Billion Loan
events.wd_description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) reached a staff-level agreement with Ukraine for a $15.6 billion loan, marking the first IMF loan to a country at war, with approval expected in the coming weeks.
events.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) reached a staff-level agreement with Ukraine for a $15.6 billion loan, marking the first IMF loan to a country at war, with approval expected in the coming weeks.

events.name: IMF Agreement with Ukraine
events.wd_description: The IMF reached a staff-level agreement with Ukraine for a $15.6 billion loan, expected to be approved in the coming weeks, to support Ukraine's economy amid the ongoing war.
events.description: The IMF reached a staff-level agreement with Ukraine for a $15.6 billion loan, expected to be approved in the coming weeks, to support Ukraine's economy amid the ongoing war.

events.name: Impact of the War on Ukraine's Economy
events.wd_label: Impact of the War on Ukraine's Economy
events.wd_description: IMF official Gavin Gray highlighted the devastating impact of Russia's invasion on Ukraine's economy, with a 30% contraction in activity in 2022 and rising poverty levels.
events.description: IMF official Gavin Gray highlighted the devastating impact of Russia's invasion on Ukraine's economy, with a 30% contraction in activity in 2022 and rising poverty levels.

events.name: Statements from Ukrainian and US Officials
events.wd_label: Statements from Ukrainian and US Officials
events.wd_description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal stated that the IMF funding would help finance critical expenditures and maintain macroeconomic stability, while US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen emphasized the importance of the IMF program in supporting Ukraine's reform efforts.
events.description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal stated that the IMF funding would help finance critical expenditures and maintain macroeconomic stability, while US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen emphasized the importance of the IMF program in supporting Ukraine's reform efforts.

events.name: EU Considers Joint Munitions Procurement for Ukraine
events.wd_label: EU Considers Joint Munitions Procurement for Ukraine
events.wd_description: The European Union is exploring a joint munitions procurement strategy to assist Ukraine, following Kyiv's warning about the urgent need for more supplies, with discussions expected among EU foreign ministers.
events.description: The European Union is exploring a joint munitions procurement strategy to assist Ukraine, following Kyiv's warning about the urgent need for more supplies, with discussions expected among EU foreign ministers.

events.name: EU Joint Munitions Procurement
events.wd_description: The European Union is considering a collective approach for member countries to jointly buy munitions for Ukraine, similar to the EU’s advance purchase of COVID vaccines.
events.description: The European Union is considering a collective approach for member countries to jointly buy munitions for Ukraine, similar to the EU’s advance purchase of COVID vaccines.

events.name: Ursula von der Leyen's Statement
events.wd_description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen emphasized the need to speed up and scale up the production of standardized munitions that Ukraine urgently requires.
events.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen emphasized the need to speed up and scale up the production of standardized munitions that Ukraine urgently requires.

events.name: Ukraine's Call for Ammunition
events.wd_description: Ukraine's Foreign Affairs Minister, Dmytro Kuleba, highlighted the critical need for ammunition, discussing the issue with defense industry leaders at the Munich conference.
events.description: Ukraine's Foreign Affairs Minister, Dmytro Kuleba, highlighted the critical need for ammunition, discussing the issue with defense industry leaders at the Munich conference.

events.name: Deadly cold weather in Asia
events.wd_description: Extreme cold weather was recorded in several Asian countries, including Japan, China, and the Korean peninsula, leading to fatalities and significant disruptions.
events.description: Extreme cold weather was recorded in several Asian countries, including Japan, China, and the Korean peninsula, leading to fatalities and significant disruptions.

events.name: Japan cold weather
events.wd_description: Deadly cold weather in Japan resulted in fatalities and caused the cancellation of hundreds of domestic flights due to heavy snow and high winds.
events.description: Deadly cold weather in Japan resulted in fatalities and caused the cancellation of hundreds of domestic flights due to heavy snow and high winds.

events.name: Korean peninsula cold weather
events.wd_description: The Korean peninsula experienced cold storms with temperatures dropping as low as -22°F (-30°C), particularly affecting the Pyongyang province.
events.description: The Korean peninsula experienced cold storms with temperatures dropping as low as -22°F (-30°C), particularly affecting the Pyongyang province.

events.name: China cold weather
events.wd_description: China's northernmost city, Mohe, recorded its lowest temperature ever at -63.4°F (-53°C), with significant temperature reductions predicted in several areas.
events.description: China's northernmost city, Mohe, recorded its lowest temperature ever at -63.4°F (-53°C), with significant temperature reductions predicted in several areas.

events.name: Opening of Ascend Elements' lithium-ion battery recycling facility
events.wd_label: Opening of Ascend Elements' lithium-ion battery recycling facility
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements opened its first commercial-scale lithium-ion battery recycling facility in Covington, Georgia. The $50 million Base 1 facility is the largest EV battery recycling facility in North America.
events.description: Ascend Elements opened its first commercial-scale lithium-ion battery recycling facility in Covington, Georgia. The $50 million Base 1 facility is the largest EV battery recycling facility in North America.

events.name: Facility opening ceremony
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements celebrated the grand opening of its Base 1 facility on March 30, 2023, marking a significant milestone in EV battery recycling.
events.description: Ascend Elements celebrated the grand opening of its Base 1 facility on March 30, 2023, marking a significant milestone in EV battery recycling.

events.name: Initial operations
events.wd_description: The facility began partial operations in August 2022, with an annual capacity to process 30,000 metric tons of used lithium-ion batteries and manufacturing scrap.
events.description: The facility began partial operations in August 2022, with an annual capacity to process 30,000 metric tons of used lithium-ion batteries and manufacturing scrap.

events.name: t: Recycling process
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements uses its patented Hydro-to-Cathode™ process to recover up to 98% of critical battery metals and reduce the carbon footprint of new EV battery cathode materials by up to 90%.
events.description: Ascend Elements uses its patented Hydro-to-Cathode™ process to recover up to 98% of critical battery metals and reduce the carbon footprint of new EV battery cathode materials by up to 90%.

events.name: t: Employment details
events.wd_description: The facility currently employs about 100 team members, with plans to increase headcount to 185 by 2024.
events.description: The facility currently employs about 100 team members, with plans to increase headcount to 185 by 2024.

events.name: t: Environmental features
events.wd_description: The facility is powered by renewable energy and features onsite wastewater recycling and treatment systems.
events.description: The facility is powered by renewable energy and features onsite wastewater recycling and treatment systems.

events.name: Future expansion plans
events.wd_description: Ascend Elements aims to continue building its closed-loop battery materials supply chain to make EV batteries cleaner and more sustainable.
events.description: Ascend Elements aims to continue building its closed-loop battery materials supply chain to make EV batteries cleaner and more sustainable.
